competitors.name: Cisco Systems
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with comprehensive networking portfolio, ACI SDN solution competed with Arista's network automation offerings

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Major competitor providing switches, routers, and security solutions targeting data centers and service providers

competitors.name: HPE/Aruba Networks
competitors.notes: Strong competitor in campus networking with wired and wireless solutions

competitors.name: Mellanox/NVIDIA
competitors.notes: High-performance networking solutions for AI/ML workloads and data centers, acquired by NVIDIA in 2020

competitors.name: Huawei Technologies
competitors.notes: Major global competitor in ICT infrastructure, offering telecom networks, IT solutions and cloud services

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Delivered software-driven networking solutions for enterprise customers

competitors.name: Pluribus Networks
competitors.notes: Performance-oriented network virtualization for private and public cloud data centers

competitors.name: Dell Technologies
competitors.notes: Networking solutions leveraging SONiC open-source network operating system

context: By 2020, cloud computing and software-defined networking had become mainstream. Arista solidified its position in hyperscale data center market competing directly with Cisco's dominance. NVIDIA's acquisition of Mellanox signaled growing importance of AI/ML workloads. Open-source networking and white-box solutions began disrupting traditional competitive landscape.
